trans-unit.source: Planning for performance
trans-unit.target: Planning for performance

trans-unit.source: Users expect their apps to remain responsive, to feel natural, and not to drain their battery.
trans-unit.target: Users expect their apps to remain responsive, to feel natural, and not to drain their battery.

trans-unit.source: Planning for performance
trans-unit.target: Planning for performance

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Users expect their apps to remain responsive, to feel natural, and not to drain their battery.
trans-unit.target: Users expect their apps to remain responsive, to feel natural, and not to drain their battery.

trans-unit.source: Technically, performance is a non-functional requirement but treating performance as a feature will help you deliver on your users' expectations.
trans-unit.target: Technically, performance is a non-functional requirement but treating performance as a feature will help you deliver on your users' expectations.

trans-unit.source: Specifying goals, and measuring, are key factors.
trans-unit.target: Specifying goals, and measuring, are key factors.

trans-unit.source: Determine what your performance-critical scenarios are; define what good performance mean.
trans-unit.target: Determine what your performance-critical scenarios are; define what good performance mean.

trans-unit.source: Then measure early and often enough throughout the lifecycle of your project to be confident you'll hit your goals.
trans-unit.target: Then measure early and often enough throughout the lifecycle of your project to be confident you'll hit your goals.

trans-unit.source: Specifying goals
trans-unit.target: Specifying goals

trans-unit.source: The user experience is a basic way to define good performance.
trans-unit.target: The user experience is a basic way to define good performance.

trans-unit.source: An app's startup time can influence a user's perception of its performance.
trans-unit.target: An app's startup time can influence a user's perception of its performance.

trans-unit.source: A user might consider an app launch time of less than one second to be excellent, less than 5 seconds to be good, and greater than 5 seconds to be poor.
trans-unit.target: A user might consider an app launch time of less than one second to be excellent, less than 5 seconds to be good, and greater than 5 seconds to be poor.

trans-unit.source: Other metrics have a less obvious impact on user experience, for example memory.
trans-unit.target: Other metrics have a less obvious impact on user experience, for example memory.

trans-unit.source: The chances of an app being terminated while either suspended or inactive rise with the amount of memory used by the active app.
trans-unit.target: The chances of an app being terminated while either suspended or inactive rise with the amount of memory used by the active app.

trans-unit.source: It's a general rule that high memory usage degrades the experience for all apps on the system, so having a goal on memory consumption is reasonable.
trans-unit.target: It's a general rule that high memory usage degrades the experience for all apps on the system, so having a goal on memory consumption is reasonable.

trans-unit.source: Take into consideration the rough size of your app as perceived by users: small, medium, or large.
trans-unit.target: Take into consideration the rough size of your app as perceived by users: small, medium, or large.

trans-unit.source: Expectations around performance will correlate to this perception.
trans-unit.target: Expectations around performance will correlate to this perception.

trans-unit.source: For example, you might want a small app that doesn't use a lot of media to consume less than 100MB of memory.
trans-unit.target: For example, you might want a small app that doesn't use a lot of media to consume less than 100MB of memory.

trans-unit.source: It's better to set an initial goal, and then revise it later, than not to have a goal at all.
trans-unit.target: It's better to set an initial goal, and then revise it later, than not to have a goal at all.

trans-unit.source: Your app's performance goals should be specific and measurable and they should fall into three categories: how long it takes users, or the app, to complete tasks (time); the rate and continuity with which the app redraws itself in response to user interaction (fluidity); and how well the app conserves system resources, including battery power (efficiency).
trans-unit.target: Your app's performance goals should be specific and measurable and they should fall into three categories: how long it takes users, or the app, to complete tasks (time); the rate and continuity with which the app redraws itself in response to user interaction (fluidity); and how well the app conserves system resources, including battery power (efficiency).

trans-unit.source: Time
trans-unit.target: Time

trans-unit.source: Think of the acceptable ranges of elapsed time (*interaction classes*) it takes for users to complete their tasks in your app.
trans-unit.target: Think of the acceptable ranges of elapsed time (*interaction classes*) it takes for users to complete their tasks in your app.

trans-unit.source: For each interaction class assign a label, a perceived user sentiment, and ideal and maximum durations.
trans-unit.target: For each interaction class assign a label, a perceived user sentiment, and ideal and maximum durations.

trans-unit.source: Here are some suggestions.
trans-unit.target: Here are some suggestions.

trans-unit.source: Interaction class label
trans-unit.target: Interaction class label

trans-unit.source: User perception
trans-unit.target: User perception

trans-unit.source: Ideal
trans-unit.target: Ideal

trans-unit.source: Maximum
trans-unit.target: Maximum

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: Fast
trans-unit.target: Fast

trans-unit.source: Minimally noticeable delay
trans-unit.target: Minimally noticeable delay

trans-unit.source: 100 milliseconds
trans-unit.target: 100 milliseconds

trans-unit.source: 200 milliseconds
trans-unit.target: 200 milliseconds

trans-unit.source: Bring up the app bar; press a button (first response)
trans-unit.target: Bring up the app bar; press a button (first response)

trans-unit.source: Typical
trans-unit.target: Typical

trans-unit.source: Quick, but not fast
trans-unit.target: Quick, but not fast

trans-unit.source: 300 milliseconds
trans-unit.target: 300 milliseconds

trans-unit.source: 500 milliseconds
trans-unit.target: 500 milliseconds

trans-unit.source: Resize; semantic zoom
trans-unit.target: Resize; semantic zoom

trans-unit.source: Responsive
trans-unit.target: Responsive

trans-unit.source: Not quick, but feels responsive
trans-unit.target: Not quick, but feels responsive

trans-unit.source: 500 milliseconds
trans-unit.target: 500 milliseconds

trans-unit.source: 1 second
trans-unit.target: 1 second

trans-unit.source: Navigate to a different page; resume the app from a suspended state
trans-unit.target: Navigate to a different page; resume the app from a suspended state

trans-unit.source: Launch
trans-unit.target: Launch

trans-unit.source: Competitive experience
trans-unit.target: Competitive experience

trans-unit.source: 1 second
trans-unit.target: 1 second

trans-unit.source: 3 seconds
trans-unit.target: 3 seconds

trans-unit.source: Launch the app for the first time or after it has been previously terminated
trans-unit.target: Launch the app for the first time or after it has been previously terminated

trans-unit.source: Continuous
trans-unit.target: Continuous

trans-unit.source: No longer feels responsive
trans-unit.target: No longer feels responsive

trans-unit.source: 500 milliseconds
trans-unit.target: 500 milliseconds

trans-unit.source: 5 seconds
trans-unit.target: 5 seconds

trans-unit.source: Download a file from the Internet
trans-unit.target: Download a file from the Internet

trans-unit.source: Captive
trans-unit.target: Captive

trans-unit.source: Long; user could switch away
trans-unit.target: Long; user could switch away

trans-unit.source: 500 milliseconds
trans-unit.target: 500 milliseconds

trans-unit.source: 10 seconds
trans-unit.target: 10 seconds

trans-unit.source: Install multiple apps from the Store
trans-unit.target: Install multiple apps from the Store

trans-unit.source: You can now assign interaction classes to your app's performance scenarios.
trans-unit.target: You can now assign interaction classes to your app's performance scenarios.

trans-unit.source: You can assign the app's point-in-time reference, a portion of the user experience, and an interaction class to each scenario.
trans-unit.target: You can assign the app's point-in-time reference, a portion of the user experience, and an interaction class to each scenario.

trans-unit.source: Here are some suggestions for an example food and dining app.
trans-unit.target: Here are some suggestions for an example food and dining app.

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: Time point
trans-unit.target: Time point

trans-unit.source: User experience
trans-unit.target: User experience

trans-unit.source: Interaction class
trans-unit.target: Interaction class

trans-unit.source: Navigate to recipe page
trans-unit.target: Navigate to recipe page

trans-unit.source: First response
trans-unit.target: First response

trans-unit.source: Page transition animation started
trans-unit.target: Page transition animation started

trans-unit.source: Fast (100-200 milliseconds)
trans-unit.target: Fast (100-200 milliseconds)

trans-unit.source: Responsive
trans-unit.target: Responsive

trans-unit.source: Ingredients list loaded; no images
trans-unit.target: Ingredients list loaded; no images

trans-unit.source: Responsive (500 milliseconds - 1 second)
trans-unit.target: Responsive (500 milliseconds - 1 second)

trans-unit.source: Visible complete
trans-unit.target: Visible complete

trans-unit.source: All content loaded; images shown
trans-unit.target: All content loaded; images shown

trans-unit.source: Continuous (500 milliseconds - 5 seconds)
trans-unit.target: Continuous (500 milliseconds - 5 seconds)

trans-unit.source: Search for recipe
trans-unit.target: Search for recipe

trans-unit.source: First response
trans-unit.target: First response

trans-unit.source: Search button clicked
trans-unit.target: Search button clicked

trans-unit.source: Fast (100 - 200 milliseconds)
trans-unit.target: Fast (100 - 200 milliseconds)

trans-unit.source: Visible complete
trans-unit.target: Visible complete

trans-unit.source: List of local recipe titles shown
trans-unit.target: List of local recipe titles shown

trans-unit.source: Typical (300 - 500 milliseconds)
trans-unit.target: Typical (300 - 500 milliseconds)

trans-unit.source: If you're displaying live content then also consider content freshness goals.
trans-unit.target: If you're displaying live content then also consider content freshness goals.

trans-unit.source: Is the goal to refresh content every few seconds?
trans-unit.target: Is the goal to refresh content every few seconds?

trans-unit.source: Or is refreshing content every few minutes, every few hours, or even once a day an acceptable user experience?
trans-unit.target: Or is refreshing content every few minutes, every few hours, or even once a day an acceptable user experience?

trans-unit.source: With your goals specified, you are now better able to test, analyze, and optimize your app.
trans-unit.target: With your goals specified, you are now better able to test, analyze, and optimize your app.

trans-unit.source: Fluidity
trans-unit.target: Fluidity

trans-unit.source: Specific measurable fluidity goals for your app might include:
trans-unit.target: Specific measurable fluidity goals for your app might include:

trans-unit.source: No screen redraw stops-and-starts (glitches).
trans-unit.target: No screen redraw stops-and-starts (glitches).

trans-unit.source: Animations render at 60 frames per second (FPS).
trans-unit.target: Animations render at 60 frames per second (FPS).

trans-unit.source: When a user pans/scrolls, the app presents 3-6 pages of content per second.
trans-unit.target: When a user pans/scrolls, the app presents 3-6 pages of content per second.

trans-unit.source: Efficiency
trans-unit.target: Efficiency

trans-unit.source: Specific measurable efficiency goals for your app might include:
trans-unit.target: Specific measurable efficiency goals for your app might include:

trans-unit.source: For your app's process, CPU percentage is at or below *N* and memory usage in MB is at or below *M* at all times.
trans-unit.target: For your app's process, CPU percentage is at or below *N* and memory usage in MB is at or below *M* at all times.

trans-unit.source: When the app is inactive, *N* and *M* are zero for your app's process.
trans-unit.target: When the app is inactive, *N* and *M* are zero for your app's process.

trans-unit.source: Your app can be used actively for *X* hours on battery power; when your app is inactive, the device retains its charge for *Y* hours.
trans-unit.target: Your app can be used actively for *X* hours on battery power; when your app is inactive, the device retains its charge for *Y* hours.

trans-unit.source: Design your app for performance
trans-unit.target: Design your app for performance

trans-unit.source: You can now use your performance goals to influence your app's design.
trans-unit.target: You can now use your performance goals to influence your app's design.

trans-unit.source: Using the example food and dining app, after the user navigates to the recipe page, you might choose to [update items incrementally](optimize-gridview-and-listview.md#update-items-incrementally) so that the recipe's name is rendered first, displaying the ingredients is deferred, and displaying images is deferred further.
trans-unit.target: Using the example food and dining app, after the user navigates to the recipe page, you might choose to [update items incrementally](optimize-gridview-and-listview.md#update-items-incrementally) so that the recipe's name is rendered first, displaying the ingredients is deferred, and displaying images is deferred further.

trans-unit.source: This maintains responsiveness and a fluid UI while panning/scrolling, with the full fidelity rendering taking place after the interaction slows to a pace that allow the UI thread to catch up.
trans-unit.target: This maintains responsiveness and a fluid UI while panning/scrolling, with the full fidelity rendering taking place after the interaction slows to a pace that allow the UI thread to catch up.

trans-unit.source: Here are some other aspects to consider.
trans-unit.target: Here are some other aspects to consider.

trans-unit.source: UI
trans-unit.target: UI

trans-unit.source: Maximize parse and load time and memory efficiency for each page of your app's UI (especially the initial page) by [optimizing your XAML markup](optimize-xaml-loading.md).
trans-unit.target: Maximize parse and load time and memory efficiency for each page of your app's UI (especially the initial page) by [optimizing your XAML markup](optimize-xaml-loading.md).

trans-unit.source: In a nutshell, defer loading UI and code until it's needed.
trans-unit.target: In a nutshell, defer loading UI and code until it's needed.

trans-unit.source: For [**ListView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242878) and [**GridView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242705), make all the items the same size and use as many [ListView and GridView optimization techniques](optimize-gridview-and-listview.md) as you can.
trans-unit.target: For [**ListView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242878) and [**GridView**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR242705), make all the items the same size and use as many [ListView and GridView optimization techniques](optimize-gridview-and-listview.md) as you can.

trans-unit.source: Declare UI in the form of markup, which the framework can load and re-use in chunks, rather than constructing it imperatively in code.
trans-unit.target: Declare UI in the form of markup, which the framework can load and re-use in chunks, rather than constructing it imperatively in code.

trans-unit.source: Collapse UI elements until the user needs them.
trans-unit.target: Collapse UI elements until the user needs them.

trans-unit.source: See the [**Visibility**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR208992) property.
trans-unit.target: See the [**Visibility**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR208992) property.

trans-unit.source: Prefer theme transitions and animations to storyboarded animations.
trans-unit.target: Prefer theme transitions and animations to storyboarded animations.

trans-unit.source: For more info, see [Animations overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt187350).
trans-unit.target: For more info, see [Animations overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt187350).

trans-unit.source: Remember that storyboarded animations require constant updates to the screen, and keep the CPU and graphics pipeline active.
trans-unit.target: Remember that storyboarded animations require constant updates to the screen, and keep the CPU and graphics pipeline active.

trans-unit.source: To preserve the battery, don't have animations running if the user is not interacting with the app.
trans-unit.target: To preserve the battery, don't have animations running if the user is not interacting with the app.

trans-unit.source: Images you load should be loaded at a size that is appropriate for the view in which you are presenting it, using the [**GetThumbnailAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR227210) method.
trans-unit.target: Images you load should be loaded at a size that is appropriate for the view in which you are presenting it, using the [**GetThumbnailAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR227210) method.

trans-unit.source: CPU, memory, and power
trans-unit.target: CPU, memory, and power

trans-unit.source: Schedule lower-priority work to run on lower-priority threads and/or cores.
trans-unit.target: Schedule lower-priority work to run on lower-priority threads and/or cores.

trans-unit.source: See [Asynchronous programming](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt187335), the [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209054) property, and the [**CoreDispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR208211) class.
trans-unit.target: See [Asynchronous programming](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt187335), the [**Dispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209054) property, and the [**CoreDispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR208211) class.

trans-unit.source: Minimize your app's memory footprint by releasing expensive resources (such as media) on suspend.
trans-unit.target: Minimize your app's memory footprint by releasing expensive resources (such as media) on suspend.

trans-unit.source: Minimize your code's working set.
trans-unit.target: Minimize your code's working set.

trans-unit.source: Avoid memory leaks by unregistering event handlers and dereferencing UI elements whenever possible.
trans-unit.target: Avoid memory leaks by unregistering event handlers and dereferencing UI elements whenever possible.

trans-unit.source: For the sake of the battery, be conservative with how often you poll for data, query a sensor, or schedule work on the CPU when it is idle.
trans-unit.target: For the sake of the battery, be conservative with how often you poll for data, query a sensor, or schedule work on the CPU when it is idle.

trans-unit.source: Data access
trans-unit.target: Data access

trans-unit.source: If possible, prefetch content.
trans-unit.target: If possible, prefetch content.

trans-unit.source: For automatic prefetching, see the [**ContentPrefetcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn279042) class.
trans-unit.target: For automatic prefetching, see the [**ContentPrefetcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn279042) class.

trans-unit.source: For manual prefetching, see the [**Windows.ApplicationModel.Background**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224847) namespace and the [**MaintenanceTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh700517) class.
trans-unit.target: For manual prefetching, see the [**Windows.ApplicationModel.Background**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR224847) namespace and the [**MaintenanceTrigger**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh700517) class.

trans-unit.source: If possible, cache content that's expensive to access.
trans-unit.target: If possible, cache content that's expensive to access.

trans-unit.source: See the [**LocalFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR241621) and [**LocalSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR241622) properties.
trans-unit.target: See the [**LocalFolder**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR241621) and [**LocalSettings**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR241622) properties.

trans-unit.source: For cache misses, show a placeholder UI as quickly as possible that indicates that the app is still loading content.
trans-unit.target: For cache misses, show a placeholder UI as quickly as possible that indicates that the app is still loading content.

trans-unit.source: Transition from placeholder to live content in a way that is not jarring to the user.
trans-unit.target: Transition from placeholder to live content in a way that is not jarring to the user.

trans-unit.source: For example, don't change the position of content under the user's finger or mouse pointer as the app loads live content.
trans-unit.target: For example, don't change the position of content under the user's finger or mouse pointer as the app loads live content.

trans-unit.source: App launch and resume
trans-unit.target: App launch and resume

trans-unit.source: Defer the app's splash screen, and don't extend the app's splash screen unless necessary.
trans-unit.target: Defer the app's splash screen, and don't extend the app's splash screen unless necessary.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Creating a fast and fluid app launch experience](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=317595) and [Display a splash screen for more time](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt187309).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Creating a fast and fluid app launch experience](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=317595) and [Display a splash screen for more time](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Mt187309).

trans-unit.source: Disable animations that occur immediately after the splash screen is dismissed, as these will only lead to a perception of delay in app launch time.
trans-unit.target: Disable animations that occur immediately after the splash screen is dismissed, as these will only lead to a perception of delay in app launch time.

trans-unit.source: Adaptive UI, and orientation
trans-unit.target: Adaptive UI, and orientation

trans-unit.source: Use the [**VisualStateManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209021) class.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**VisualStateManager**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR209021) class.

trans-unit.source: Complete only required work immediately, deferring intensive app work until later—your app has between 200 and 800 milliseconds to complete work before the user sees your app's UI in a cropped state.
trans-unit.target: Complete only required work immediately, deferring intensive app work until later—your app has between 200 and 800 milliseconds to complete work before the user sees your app's UI in a cropped state.

trans-unit.source: With your performance-related designs in place, you can start coding your app.
trans-unit.target: With your performance-related designs in place, you can start coding your app.

trans-unit.source: Instrument for performance
trans-unit.target: Instrument for performance

trans-unit.source: As you code, add code that logs messages and events at certain points while your app runs.
trans-unit.target: As you code, add code that logs messages and events at certain points while your app runs.

trans-unit.source: Later, when you're testing your app, you can use profiling tools such as Windows Performance Recorder and Windows Performance Analyzer (both are included in the [Windows Performance Toolkit](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh162945.aspx)) to create and view a report about your app's performance.
trans-unit.target: Later, when you're testing your app, you can use profiling tools such as Windows Performance Recorder and Windows Performance Analyzer (both are included in the [Windows Performance Toolkit](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/xaml/hh162945.aspx)) to create and view a report about your app's performance.

trans-unit.source: In this report, you can look for these messages and events to help you more easily analyze the report's results.
trans-unit.target: In this report, you can look for these messages and events to help you more easily analyze the report's results.

trans-unit.source: The Universal Windows Platform (UWP) provides logging APIs, backed by [Event Tracing for Windows (ETW)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Bb968803), that together offer a rich event logging and tracing solution.
trans-unit.target: The Universal Windows Platform (UWP) provides logging APIs, backed by [Event Tracing for Windows (ETW)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/Bb968803), that together offer a rich event logging and tracing solution.

trans-unit.source: The APIs, which are part of the [**Windows.Foundation.Diagnostics**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR206677) namespace, include the [**FileLoggingSession**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264138), [**LoggingActivity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264195), [**LoggingChannel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264202), and [**LoggingSession**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264217) classes.
trans-unit.target: The APIs, which are part of the [**Windows.Foundation.Diagnostics**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR206677) namespace, include the [**FileLoggingSession**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264138), [**LoggingActivity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264195), [**LoggingChannel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264202), and [**LoggingSession**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264217) classes.

trans-unit.source: To log a message in the report at a specific point while the app is running, create a **LoggingChannel** object, and then call the object's [**LogMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264202-logmessage) method, like this.
trans-unit.target: To log a message in the report at a specific point while the app is running, create a **LoggingChannel** object, and then call the object's [**LogMessage**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264202-logmessage) method, like this.

trans-unit.source: To log start and stop events in the report over a period of time while the app is running, create a **LoggingActivity** object, and then call the object's [**LoggingActivity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264195-loggingactivity) constructor, like this.
trans-unit.target: To log start and stop events in the report over a period of time while the app is running, create a **LoggingActivity** object, and then call the object's [**LoggingActivity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn264195-loggingactivity) constructor, like this.

trans-unit.source: Also see the [Logging sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529576).
trans-unit.target: Also see the [Logging sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529576).

trans-unit.source: With your app instrumented, you can test and measure your app's performance.
trans-unit.target: With your app instrumented, you can test and measure your app's performance.

trans-unit.source: Test and measure against performance goals
trans-unit.target: Test and measure against performance goals

trans-unit.source: Part of your performance plan is to define the points during development where you'll measure performance.
trans-unit.target: Part of your performance plan is to define the points during development where you'll measure performance.

trans-unit.source: This serves different purposes depending on whether you're measuring during prototyping, development, or deployment.
trans-unit.target: This serves different purposes depending on whether you're measuring during prototyping, development, or deployment.

trans-unit.source: Measuring performance during the early stages of prototyping can be tremendously valuable, so we recommend that you do so as soon as you have code that does meaningful work.
trans-unit.target: Measuring performance during the early stages of prototyping can be tremendously valuable, so we recommend that you do so as soon as you have code that does meaningful work.

trans-unit.source: Early measurements give you a good idea of where the important costs are in your app, and inform design decisions.
trans-unit.target: Early measurements give you a good idea of where the important costs are in your app, and inform design decisions.

trans-unit.source: This results in high performing and scaling apps.
trans-unit.target: This results in high performing and scaling apps.

trans-unit.source: It's generally costlier to change designs later than earlier.
trans-unit.target: It's generally costlier to change designs later than earlier.

trans-unit.source: Measuring performance late in the product cycle can result in last-minute hacks and poor performance.
trans-unit.target: Measuring performance late in the product cycle can result in last-minute hacks and poor performance.

trans-unit.source: Use these techniques and tools to test how your app stacks up against your original performance goals.
trans-unit.target: Use these techniques and tools to test how your app stacks up against your original performance goals.

trans-unit.source: Test against a wide variety of hardware configurations including all-in-one and desktop PCs, laptops, ultrabooks, and tablets and other mobile devices.
trans-unit.target: Test against a wide variety of hardware configurations including all-in-one and desktop PCs, laptops, ultrabooks, and tablets and other mobile devices.

trans-unit.source: Test against a wide variety of screen sizes.
trans-unit.target: Test against a wide variety of screen sizes.

trans-unit.source: While wider screen sizes can show much more content, bringing in all of that extra content can negatively impact performance.
trans-unit.target: While wider screen sizes can show much more content, bringing in all of that extra content can negatively impact performance.

trans-unit.source: Eliminate as many testing variables as you can.
trans-unit.target: Eliminate as many testing variables as you can.

trans-unit.source: Turn off background apps on the testing device.
trans-unit.target: Turn off background apps on the testing device.

trans-unit.source: To do this, in Windows, select **Settings** from the Start menu > **Personalization** > **Lock screen**.
trans-unit.target: To do this, in Windows, select **Settings** from the Start menu > **Personalization** > **Lock screen**.

trans-unit.source: Select each active app and select **None**.
trans-unit.target: Select each active app and select **None**.

trans-unit.source: Compile your app to native code by building it in release configuration before deploying it to the testing device.
trans-unit.target: Compile your app to native code by building it in release configuration before deploying it to the testing device.

trans-unit.source: To ensure that automatic maintenance does not affect the performance of the testing device, trigger it manually and wait for it to complete.
trans-unit.target: To ensure that automatic maintenance does not affect the performance of the testing device, trigger it manually and wait for it to complete.

trans-unit.source: In Windows, in the Start menu search for **Security and Maintenance**.
trans-unit.target: In Windows, in the Start menu search for **Security and Maintenance**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Maintenance** area, under **Automatic Maintenance**, select **Start maintenance** and wait for the status to change from **Maintenance in progress**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Maintenance** area, under **Automatic Maintenance**, select **Start maintenance** and wait for the status to change from **Maintenance in progress**.

trans-unit.source: Run the app multiple times to help eliminate random testing variables and help ensure consistent measurements.
trans-unit.target: Run the app multiple times to help eliminate random testing variables and help ensure consistent measurements.

trans-unit.source: Test for reduced power availability.
trans-unit.target: Test for reduced power availability.

trans-unit.source: Your users' device might have significantly less power than your development machine.
trans-unit.target: Your users' device might have significantly less power than your development machine.

trans-unit.source: Windows was designed with low-power devices, such as mobile devices, in mind.
trans-unit.target: Windows was designed with low-power devices, such as mobile devices, in mind.

trans-unit.source: Apps that run on the platform should ensure they perform well on these devices.
trans-unit.target: Apps that run on the platform should ensure they perform well on these devices.

trans-unit.source: As a heuristic, expect that a low power device runs at about a quarter the speed of a desktop computer, and set your goals accordingly.
trans-unit.target: As a heuristic, expect that a low power device runs at about a quarter the speed of a desktop computer, and set your goals accordingly.

trans-unit.source: Use a combination of tools like Microsoft Visual Studio and Windows Performance Analyzer to measure app performance.
trans-unit.target: Use a combination of tools like Microsoft Visual Studio and Windows Performance Analyzer to measure app performance.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio is designed to provide app-focused analysis, such as source code linking.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio is designed to provide app-focused analysis, such as source code linking.

trans-unit.source: Windows Performance Analyzer is designed to provide system-focused analysis, such as providing system info, info about touch manipulation events, and info about disk input/output (I/O) and graphics processing unit (GPU) cost.
trans-unit.target: Windows Performance Analyzer is designed to provide system-focused analysis, such as providing system info, info about touch manipulation events, and info about disk input/output (I/O) and graphics processing unit (GPU) cost.

trans-unit.source: Both tools provide trace capture and export, and can reopen shared and post-mortem traces.
trans-unit.target: Both tools provide trace capture and export, and can reopen shared and post-mortem traces.

trans-unit.source: Before you submit your app to the Store for certification, be sure to incorporate into your test plans the performance-related test cases as described in the "Performance tests" section of [Windows App Certification Kit tests](windows-app-certification-kit-tests.md) and in the "Performance and stability" section of [Windows Store app test cases](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn275879).
trans-unit.target: Before you submit your app to the Store for certification, be sure to incorporate into your test plans the performance-related test cases as described in the "Performance tests" section of [Windows App Certification Kit tests](windows-app-certification-kit-tests.md) and in the "Performance and stability" section of [Windows Store app test cases](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Dn275879).

trans-unit.source: For more info, see these resources and profiling tools.
trans-unit.target: For more info, see these resources and profiling tools.

trans-unit.source: Windows Performance Analyzer
trans-unit.target: Windows Performance Analyzer

trans-unit.source: Windows Performance Toolkit
trans-unit.target: Windows Performance Toolkit

trans-unit.source: Analyze performance using Visual Studio diagnostic tools
trans-unit.target: Analyze performance using Visual Studio diagnostic tools

trans-unit.source: The //build/ session [XAML Performance](https://channel9.msdn.com/Events/Build/2015/3-698)
trans-unit.target: The //build/ session [XAML Performance](https://channel9.msdn.com/Events/Build/2015/3-698)

trans-unit.source: The //build/ session [New XAML Tools in Visual Studio 2015](https://channel9.msdn.com/Events/Build/2015/2-697)
trans-unit.target: The //build/ session [New XAML Tools in Visual Studio 2015](https://channel9.msdn.com/Events/Build/2015/2-697)

trans-unit.source: Respond to the performance test results
trans-unit.target: Respond to the performance test results

trans-unit.source: After you analyze your performance test results, determine if any changes are needed, for example:
trans-unit.target: After you analyze your performance test results, determine if any changes are needed, for example:

trans-unit.source: Should you change any of your app design decisions, or optimize your code?
trans-unit.target: Should you change any of your app design decisions, or optimize your code?

trans-unit.source: Should you add, remove, or change any of the instrumentation in the code?
trans-unit.target: Should you add, remove, or change any of the instrumentation in the code?

trans-unit.source: Should you revise any of your performance goals?
trans-unit.target: Should you revise any of your performance goals?

trans-unit.source: If any changes are needed, make them and then go back to instrumenting or testing and repeat.
trans-unit.target: If any changes are needed, make them and then go back to instrumenting or testing and repeat.

trans-unit.source: Optimizing
trans-unit.target: Optimizing

trans-unit.source: Optimize only the performance-critical code paths in your app: those where most time is spent.
trans-unit.target: Optimize only the performance-critical code paths in your app: those where most time is spent.

trans-unit.source: Profiling will tell you which.
trans-unit.target: Profiling will tell you which.

trans-unit.source: Often, there is a trade-off between creating software that follows good design practices and writing code that performs at the highest optimization.
trans-unit.target: Often, there is a trade-off between creating software that follows good design practices and writing code that performs at the highest optimization.

trans-unit.source: It is generally better to prioritize developer productivity and good software design in areas where performance is not a concern.
trans-unit.target: It is generally better to prioritize developer productivity and good software design in areas where performance is not a concern.
